00016 #include <stdlib.h>
00017 #include <stdint.h>
00018 #include <stdio.h>
00019 #include <errno.h>
00020 #include <sys/types.h>
00021 #include <string.h>

00027 size_t ya_string_escape(uint8_t *string, size_t string_size, int raw)
00028 {
00029     uint8_t         c;
00030     unsigned int    i, j;
00031     int             escape = 0;
00032     int             base = 0;
00033     int             count = 0;
00034     int32_t         code_point = 0;
00035 
00036     for (i = 0, j = 0; i < string_size; i++) {
00037         c = string[i];
00038         if (count) {
00039             // We have a hex digit to decode.
00040             if (c >= '0' && c <= '9') {
00041                 code_point = (code_point << 4) | (c - '0');
00042             } else if (c >= 'a' && c <= 'f') {
00043                 code_point = (code_point << 4) | (c - 'a' + 10);
00044             } else if (c >= 'A' && c <= 'F') {
00045                 code_point = (code_point << 4) | (c - 'A' + 10);
00046             } else {
00047                 ya_error("Could not decode hex escape character.");
00048             }
00049 
00050             // If this is the last digit to expect, then add it as a character.
00051             if (--count == 0) {
00052                 if        (code_point <= 0x7f) {
00053                     string[j++] = code_point;
00054                 } else if (code_point <= 0x7ff) {
00055                     string[j++] = 0xc0 | ((code_point >> 6) & 0x1f);
00056                     string[j++] = 0x80 | ((code_point     ) & 0x3f);
00057                 } else if (code_point <= 0xffff) {
00058                     string[j++] = 0xe0 | ((code_point >> 12) & 0x0f);
00059                     string[j++] = 0x80 | ((code_point >>  6) & 0x3f);
00060                     string[j++] = 0x80 | ((code_point      ) & 0x3f);
00061                 } else if (code_point <= 0x1fffff) {
00062                     string[j++] = 0xf0 | ((code_point >> 18) & 0x07);
00063                     string[j++] = 0x80 | ((code_point >> 12) & 0x3f);
00064                     string[j++] = 0x80 | ((code_point >>  6) & 0x3f);
00065                     string[j++] = 0x80 | ((code_point      ) & 0x3f);
00066                 } else if (code_point <= 0x3ffffff) {
00067                     string[j++] = 0xf8 | ((code_point >> 24) & 0x03);
00068                     string[j++] = 0x80 | ((code_point >> 18) & 0x3f);
00069                     string[j++] = 0x80 | ((code_point >> 12) & 0x3f);
00070                     string[j++] = 0x80 | ((code_point >>  6) & 0x3f);
00071                     string[j++] = 0x80 | ((code_point      ) & 0x3f);
00072                 } else if (code_point <= 0x7fffffff) {
00073                     string[j++] = 0xfc | ((code_point >> 30) & 0x01);
00074                     string[j++] = 0x80 | ((code_point >> 24) & 0x3f);
00075                     string[j++] = 0x80 | ((code_point >> 18) & 0x3f);
00076                     string[j++] = 0x80 | ((code_point >> 12) & 0x3f);
00077                     string[j++] = 0x80 | ((code_point >>  6) & 0x3f);
00078                     string[j++] = 0x80 | ((code_point      ) & 0x3f);
00079                 } else {
00080                     ya_error("Could not encode code point %lli.", (long long)code_point);
00081                 }
00082                 string[j++] = code_point;
00083             }
00084 
00085         } else if (escape) {
00086             escape = 0;
00087             // There was an escape character previously. We have different kind of escaping,
00088             switch (raw) {
00089             case 2: // Raw regex
00090                 switch (c) {
00091                 case '/': string[j++] = '/';  break;
00092                 default:  string[j++] = '\\'; string[j++] = c;
00093                 }
00094                 break;
00095             case 1: // Raw string
00096                 switch (c) {
00097                 case '"': string[j++] = '"';  break;
00098                 default:  string[j++] = '\\'; string[j++] = c;
00099                 }
00100                 break;
00101             default: // Cooked string
00102                 switch (c) {
00103                 case 'n': string[j++] = '\n'; break;
00104                 case 'r': string[j++] = '\r'; break;
00105                 case 't': string[j++] = '\t'; break;
00106                 case '"': string[j++] = '"';  break;
00107                 case '/': string[j++] = '/';  break;
00108                 case '\\': string[j++] = '\\';  break;
00109                 case 'x': base = 16; count = 2; code_point = 0; break;
00110                 case 'u': base = 16; count = 4; code_point = 0; break;
00111                 case 'U': base = 16; count = 8; code_point = 0; break;
00112                 default:  string[j++] = '\\'; string[j++] = c;
00113                 }
00114             }
00115         } else if (c == '\\') {
00116             // We found the escape character, see if we have to do anything.
00117             escape = 1;
00118 
00119         } else {
00120             string[j++] = c;
00121         }
00122     }
00123 
00124     // Lonely escape character at the end of the string should be emitted.
00125     if (escape) {
00126         string[j++] = '\\';
00127     }
00128 
00129     return j;
00130 }
00131 
00132 char *ya_new_extension(char *filename, char *new_extension)
00133 {
00134     char   *filename_result;
00135     // Copy the string to strip the extension.
00136     char   *filename_copy = strdup(filename);
00137     // Find the last dot in the filename.
00138     char   *last_dot = strrchr(filename_copy, '.');
00139 
00140     if (last_dot) {
00141         // Set the last dot in the filename_copy to a nul terminating character.
00142         *last_dot = 0;
00143     }
00144 
00145     // Append the new extension to the filename_copy without the last extension.
00146     if (asprintf(&filename_result, "%s.%s", filename_copy, new_extension) == -1) {
00147         perror("Could not allocate filename with extension\n");
00148         abort();
00149     }
00150 
00151     free(filename_copy);
00152 
00153     return filename_result;
00154 }
